Todo List Tutorial

Wed, Dec 30, 2015

This example walks you through a hypothetical project that is building a todo list. It specifically uses a todo list because it’s a super well-understood application and hopefully this allows you to focus entirely on the new concepts. This example builds a server and then a client.

swagger.json generation

Mon, Nov 9, 2015

The toolkit has a command that will let you generate a swagger spec document from your code. The command integrates with go doc comments, and makes use of structs when it needs to know of types.

Generate an API client

Fri, Oct 23, 2015

The toolkit has a command that will let you generate a client.

Use custom tempaltes

Tue, Jan 26, 2016

When generating a server or client you can specify a directory to load custom templates from with --template-dir. It will recursively read all the .gotmpl files in the directory and load them as templates.

Generate a server for a swagger spec

Sun, Nov 22, 2015

The toolkit has a command that will let you generate a docker friendly server with support for TLS. You can configure it through environment variables that are commonly used on PaaS services.

Validate a swagger spec

Thu, Oct 22, 2015

The toolkit has a command to validate swagger specifications for you. It includes a full json-schema validator and adds some extra validations to ensure the spec is valid.

Use the generated server

Wed, Dec 23, 2015

The generated server serves the API but the default implementation returns 501 Not implemented for everything. Let’s look into using the generated code.

BYO middleware

Sat, Dec 26, 2015

Go-swagger chose the golang net/http package as base abstraction. That means that for any supported transport by the toolkit you can reuse any middleware existing middlewares that following the stdlib middlware pattern.

Schema generation rules

Sat, Dec 26, 2015

Lots of the work of go-swagger is to generate models, which can have all kinds of rules like polymorphism and validations. Of course none of this is possible without set of rules and tradeoffs.

Dynamic API definition

Sun, Nov 22, 2015

The toolkit supports building a swagger specification entirely with go code. It does allow you to serve a spec up quickly. This is one of the building blocks required to serve up stub API’s and to generate a test server with predictable responses, however this is not as bad as it sounds…

Untyped API server

Sun, Nov 22, 2015

The toolkit supports serving a swagger spec with untyped data. This means that it uses mostly interface{} as params to each operation and as result type. It does allow you to serve a spec up quickly. This is one of the building blocks required to serve up stub API’s and to generate a test server with predictable responses.

What is go-swagger

Wed, Oct 21, 2015

There are 2 axis along which your API and its documentation tend to evolve. This toolkit aims to support you along all axis and remove the repetitive nature of writing what is essentially boilerplate code for faster iteration times.
